title: Need to import mail from Outlook 2007 located on anothe computer
content:
I have a new Windows 11 PC and have installed Thunderbird (64bit). My current email is via my ISP who have outsourced their email to Gmail - I am using IMAP. This setup is in Outlook 2007 on my old PC. I have setup Thunderbird to obtain all of my current email from the IMAP server at Gmail. This went successfully.

I now wish to move all of my off-line stored emails from this old Outlook installation and also my calendar. When I started the import process on Thunderbird and selected Outlook as a source all I really wanted to do was to find out what Thunderbird would ask for in the way of files containing my data. But, as per other postings that I have found on this site it came up with the "No profile found" .

However Outlook is NOT installed on the Windows 11 computer and nor have I created any pst files or any other files and moved them to the Windows 11 PC. So the 32bit vs 64bit answer does not yet apply to my situation.

So what process should I follow to move my data from the old Outlook 32bit installation on my old Windows 10 PC to the new Thunderbird 64bit setup?

Thanks for any advice
creator: paul89895

title: Global indexing makes Thunderbird very unresponsive after update to v128
content:
Thunderbird automatically updated to v128 earlier this week after I went to Help - About Thunderbird to check that it had updated to v115.14.

Everything seemed okay immediately after the update, but when I started Thunderbird the next day it was very unresponsive. Checking the Activity Manager showed that Thunderbird was indexing messages, but that this was happening very slowly. I let Thunderbird do its thing that day in the hope that things would settle down.

The next day when I started Thunderbird things were still bad. I tried Rebuilding the Global Database but when I restarted Thunderbird it was just as bad, if not worse.

I then turned off indexing in the Thunderbird settings and Thunderbird is now responsive and back to normal.

Is anyone else seeing anything like this? Any suggestions to fix the problem?

I am a long time Thunderbird user so my profile is very large with a lot of accounts, and has been through a lot of Thunderbird versions, so it is potentially more complicated than normal.

Thunderbird version is currently 128.1.0esr (32-bit).

Thanks
creator: zatz

content:

Any suggestions?

title: verzenden gmail account werkt niet
content:
Vanmorgen wilde een van mijn mijn mail Gmail accounts niet meer verzenden, bij het venster met de vraag om het wachtwoord in te vullen komt er geen nieuw venster, maar verschijnt hetzelfde venster zie screenshot 1. Aan de SMPT instellingen is niks gewijzigd schreenshot 2. - Via Gmail, Thunderbird ontkoppeld, opnieuw aangemeld via Oauth ontvangen werkt, maar verzenden blijft het zelfde probleem. - Gmail wachtwoord gewijzigd, zelfde als ontkoppelen voor ontvangen wel Oauth opnieuw, verzenden lukt niet. - Daarna wachtwoord van de mail in Thunderbird verwijderd, zelfde effect hij vraagt wel om Nieuw wachtwoord invoeren maar opent geen venster. - ondanks dat het voorheen werkte en ook op andere nog PC werkt Cookies uitzonderingen voor Google toegevoegd aan Thunderbird. - andere smpt server geprobeerd (smtp.gmail.com) werkt ook niet. - firewall en antivirussoftware uitgeschakeld, geen verschil Probleem is dat er geen Oauth venster wordt geopend bij verzenden en alleen bij ophalen

Systeem info Processor 11th Gen Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-1165G7 @ 2.80GHz 2.80 GHz Geïnstalleerd RAM-geheugen 16,0 GB (15,7 GB beschikbaar) Type systeem 64-bits besturingssysteem, x64-processor

Editie Windows 11 Pro Versie 23H2 Installatiedatum ‎8-‎11-‎2022 Build van besturingssysteem 22631.3880

Thunderbird 128.1.0esr (64-bits) Internetverbinding via Ziggo

AANVULLEND Inmiddels ook gekeken naar instellingen server en verzenden geprobeerd op laptop met eerdere versie TB. Zelfde probleem wachtwoord vraag komt wel voor IMAP en inloggen met Oauth werkt, maar bij verzenden komt vraag wachtwoord wel maar knop wijzigen geeft geen venster om in te loggen.

title: Problems with Thunderbird Inbox since a day before V128 Update
content:
On 31 July, a day before the Thunderbird update from V115 to V128, the emails in my inbox no longer had reply or forward options and were addressed as coming from me as well as to me.

A yellow message at the bottom of each email read: "A unique identity matching the From address was not found. The message will be sent using the current From field and settings from identity Marcus Relton <my email address>"

My email provider thinks Thunderbird mistakenly believes these emails to be drafts. I have added on FolderFlags, which now has a V128 version since I first experienced this problem last week.

I am supposed to be able to right-click the inbox, go down the drop-down menu to properties then see another dialogue box but this isn't appearing.

I can only reply to or forward emails by right-clicking in the message in the inbox and I can't click on links in the email. I have to open the link then cut and paste them.

Mail.coop, here in the UK is trying to find a solution, having hoped FolderFlags would work, but if anyone has any suggestions, please share.

I saw someone had a similar problem with their drafts folder in April but the suggested fix didn't solve it.


Thanks,

Marcus
creator: m.j.relton
